title: Why is a 100 slope a 45 degree angle? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not 100, but 100%. Slope is the ratio rise/run. If the rise is the same as the run, the ratio is 1, which is the same as 100%. Equal rise and run form a 45 - 45 - 90 triangle. For example, consider starting at the origin and moving to the point (3, 3). The segment from (0, 0) to (3, 3) forms a 45 deg. angle with the x-axis, and has slope 3/3= 1.
You mean, a 100% slope. As a percentage, slope is rise over run. So, if the rise equals the run (as in a 45 degree triangle), the slope will be 100%
